intro: Nesaea myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtleleaf nesaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has simple, opposite, and often aromatic leaves that are reminiscent of myrtle leaves, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
